requirement_title: Implement and Maintain a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement: Develop and maintain a BCMS that addresses the organization's needs and establishes business continuity policies and objectives.
requirement_description: The organization should have a system in place to manage business continuity, considering its specific needs, legal requirements, and potential impacts of disruptions.

controls.control: Appoint a BCMS steering committee, define roles and responsibilities, and establish clear lines of authority.
Identify critical business processes, systems, and resources, assess their impact on the organization in case of a disruption, and prioritize recovery efforts.
Establish policies that outline the organization's approach to business continuity, including roles, responsibilities, and expectations for employees.
Create and maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, plans, and training materials.

requirement_title: Operate and Maintain Processes for Disruption Response
requirement: Establish and maintain processes, capabilities, and response structures to ensure the organization can survive disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization should have mechanisms in place to respond effectively to disruptions.

controls.control: Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Business Continuity Plan (BCP) that outlines procedures for responding to various types of disruptions.
Conduct regular disaster recovery drills to test the effectiveness of the BCP and identify areas for improvement.
Implement a robust data backup and storage strategy, ensuring critical data is regularly backed up and stored off-site or in the cloud.
Provide regular training to employees on their roles and responsibilities during a disaster, including how to follow the BCP.
Develop relationships with multiple suppliers for critical goods and services to minimize disruptions in case of supplier failure or disruption.

requirement: Regularly monitor and review the performance and effectiveness of the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should assess the efficiency and effectiveness of its business continuity management system.

controls.control: Establish a schedule to monitor the performance of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) on a regular basis. This includes checking system availability, response times, and overall functionality.

Conduct periodic reviews to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS in ensuring business continuity. This includes testing the BCMS plan, evaluating its implementation, and making necessary improvements.

controls.control_title: Establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for BCMS
controls.control: Define key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of the BCMS. These KPIs could include metrics such as incident response time, recovery time objective, and business resumption priority.

controls.control_title: Document Lessons Learned from BCMS Incidents
controls.control: Maintain a record of lessons learned from incidents managed by the BCMS. This information can be used to improve the BCMS and prevent similar incidents in the future.

controls.control_title: Training and Awareness Program for BCMS
controls.control: Implement a training and awareness program to ensure all relevant staff are aware of their roles and responsibilities within the BCMS. This could include regular refresher courses, drills, and simulations.

requirement: Implement continual improvement based on qualitative and quantitative measures.
requirement_description: The organization should continuously improve its business continuity management system using both qualitative and quantitative data.

controls.control: Develop, document, and implement a formal continuous improvement program that includes regular reviews of processes, systems, and controls.
Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of business operations. Review these metrics regularly to identify areas for improvement.

Schedule periodic reviews of key business processes to ensure they remain effective, efficient, and aligned with organizational goals. Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement changes as necessary.
Create mechanisms for employees, customers, and other stakeholders to provide feedback on business operations. Use this feedback to identify areas for improvement and make necessary changes.

Provide ongoing training and development opportunities for employees to improve their skills, knowledge, and abilities. This can help identify areas where processes or controls may need to be updated or improved.

requirement: A BCMS includes a policy, competent people with defined responsibilities, management processes, documented information supporting operational control, and performance evaluation.
requirement_description: The organization should define the necessary components of its business continuity management system.

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a comprehensive Business Continuity Management System policy that outlines the organization's approach to managing risks and ensuring business continuity.
Define roles and responsibilities for individuals involved in the management, maintenance, and execution of the BCMS, including a BCMS owner, team members, and supporting functions.
Create documented processes for identifying, assessing, and managing risks; establishing business impact analysis procedures; developing response strategies; and conducting recovery planning.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, processes, plans, and procedures, as well as relevant supporting information such as risk assessments and business impact analyses.
Regularly review and evaluate the effectiveness of the BCMS, including testing and exercising response plans, assessing the adequacy of resources, and identifying areas for improvement.

requirement: Develop a policy for the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should have a written policy outlining its approach to business continuity management.

controls.control: Develop and publish a clear, concise, and easily accessible policy statement that outlines the purpose, scope, and objectives of the BCMS.
Clearly define roles and responsibilities for BCMS management, implementation, maintenance, and testing to ensure accountability and effective coordination.
Create detailed procedures that outline the steps to be taken during various phases of a business disruption, including preparation, response, recovery, and follow-up.
Develop and implement a training program to ensure that all relevant personnel are aware of their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any necessary procedures.
Regularly test and exercise the BCMS to ensure its effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and maintain the skills of personnel involved.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, training materials, and test results, to facilitate understanding and compliance.

requirement: Develop a plan for implementing and operating the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should have a detailed plan outlining how it will implement and operate its business continuity management system.

controls.control: Create a detailed plan outlining the steps, timelines, and resources required to implement and operate the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
Designate clear roles and responsibilities for BCMS team members, including primary contacts, backup contacts, and functional area representatives
Develop and document policies and procedures for various BCMS-related activities such as incident management, disaster recovery, and business resumption

controls.control_title: Conduct BCMS Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness sessions to ensure all relevant personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any related policies and procedures

controls.control_title: Schedule Regular BCMS Testing and Exercises
controls.control: Plan and execute regular tests and exercises to validate the effectiveness of the BCMS, identify areas for improvement, and maintain readiness
Keep all BCMS-related documentation up-to-date, including policies, procedures, plans, and records of tests and exercises

requirement: Implement and operate the BCMS according to the plan.
requirement_description: The organization should execute its business continuity management system as per the established plan.

controls.control: Assemble a dedicated team responsible for the planning, deployment, and operation of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
Create a detailed plan outlining the steps required to deploy the BCMS, including timelines, resources, and responsibilities
Develop and maintain comprehensive procedures for managing incidents, testing the BCMS, and maintaining the system on a regular basis
Provide training to all personnel involved in the operation of the BCMS, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities during an incident
Establish a schedule for testing the BCMS to ensure its effectiveness and identify any areas for improvement

requirement: Assess the performance of the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of its business continuity management system.

controls.control: Establish a system to continuously monitor the performance of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and identify any potential issues or bottlenecks.
Generate regular reports on the performance of the BCMS, including key metrics such as response times, system availability, and incident resolution rates.
Conduct periodic audits to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS performance monitoring and reporting processes.

requirement: Regularly review the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should periodically review its business continuity management system to ensure it remains effective.

controls.control: Establish a regular schedule for reviewing the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure its effectiveness and relevance.
Implement a version control system for the BCMS documents to track changes, updates, and revisions over time.
Create a testing schedule for the BCMS to verify its functionality and effectiveness in responding to various scenarios.
Archive older versions of the BCMS documents that are no longer in use, while maintaining their availability for reference purposes.

requirement: Implement continual improvement based on the results of the management review.
requirement_description: The organization should make improvements to its business continuity management system based on the findings from the management review.

controls.control: Establish a regular schedule for management reviews, ideally quarterly or semi-annually
Implement a system to track and manage action items from the management review, assign responsibilities, and set deadlines
Create a process for documenting lessons learned during the management review, including successes, areas for improvement, and best practices

requirement: performance assessment
requirement_description: The organization should conduct regular assessments of its performance.

controls.control: Define and document the current system's performance metrics, such as response times, throughput, and resource utilization.
Implement a monitoring solution to continuously track system performance and identify any deviations from the established baseline.
Schedule periodic assessments of system performance to ensure that the system continues to meet the defined service level agreements (SLAs) and business requirements.
Maintain a record of any performance improvements made, including the reasons for the changes, the expected impact on system performance, and actual results.

requirement: management review
requirement_description: The organization should regularly review its management practices.

controls.control: Conduct regular meetings with senior management to discuss and review compliance status, risks, and improvement opportunities
Perform periodic risk assessments to identify potential compliance issues and prioritize remediation efforts
Develop and maintain written procedures for management review, including frequency, scope, and responsibilities

requirement: continual improvement
requirement_description: The organization should strive for continuous improvement in its operations.

controls.control: Develop and implement a formal program to continuously evaluate, improve, and optimize business processes and systems.
Conduct regular performance reviews of key business processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.
Implement a mechanism for employees to provide feedback on potential improvements in the organization's operations.
Provide ongoing training and development opportunities for employees to improve their skills and knowledge, which can lead to process improvements.
Establish and track KPIs related to business processes and systems to identify areas for improvement and measure the effectiveness of implemented changes.

requirement_title: Documented Information Supporting Operational Control and Performance Evaluation
requirement: documented information supporting operational control and enabling performance evaluation
requirement_description: The organization should maintain documented information that supports its operational control and enables performance evaluation.

controls.control_title: Maintain Comprehensive Documentation for Operational Control
controls.control: Create and maintain detailed documentation outlining all operational procedures, including system configurations, access controls, change management processes, and incident response plans.
Define measurable key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the effectiveness of operational controls and continuously improve system performance.
Create documentation for less frequent tasks, such as system backups, software updates, and hardware maintenance, to ensure consistency and efficiency in their execution.

article_text:
0.2   Benefits of a business continuity management system
The purpose of a BCMS is to prepare for, provide and maintain controls and capabilities for managing an organization’s overall ability to continue to operate during disruptions.
• a) from a business perspective:
requirement: supporting its strategic objectives
requirement_description: The organization should support its strategic objectives through the implementation of a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS).

controls.control: Develop measurable and achievable strategic objectives that align with the organization's mission, vision, and values.
Conduct a SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) to identify internal and external factors that may impact the achievement of strategic objectives.
Establish relevant KPIs to measure progress towards achieving strategic objectives and monitor performance regularly.
Review the organization's strategic objectives periodically to ensure they remain relevant, achievable, and aligned with the current business environment.

article_text: Clause 4 introduces the requirements necessary to establish the context of the BCMS applicable to the organization, as well as needs, requirements and scope.
requirement: Establish the context, needs, requirements, and scope for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement_description: The organization must define the applicability of its BCMS within its operations and identify relevant stakeholders, risks, and objectives.

controls.control: Clearly outline the areas, processes, systems, and personnel that will be included in the Business Continuity Management System
Determine essential business functions, dependencies, and recovery time objectives to ensure continuity of operations during disruptions
Set measurable goals for the Business Continuity Management System that align with organizational objectives and risk appetite
Develop policies that guide the development, implementation, maintenance, and improvement of the Business Continuity Management System
Create a comprehensive list of requirements for the Business Continuity Management System, including resources, roles, responsibilities, and procedures

article_text: Clause 5 summarizes the requirements specific to top management’s role in the BCMS, and how leadership articulates its expectations to the organization via a policy statement.
requirement: Top management shall define and communicate their expectations for the BCMS through a policy statement
requirement_description: Leadership must establish clear expectations for the BCMS and communicate them effectively throughout the organization.

controls.control: Develop a clear, concise, and communicative policy statement outlining the expectations for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS). This should be approved by top management and made available to all relevant personnel.
Effectively communicate the BCMS policy statement to all relevant personnel, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities within the system.
Regularly review and update the BCMS policy statement as necessary to ensure it remains relevant, effective, and aligned with organizational goals and any changes in the business environment.

article_text: Clause 6 describes the requirements for establishing strategic objectives and guiding principles for the BCMS as a whole.
requirement: Establish strategic objectives and guiding principles for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement_description: The organization must set high-level goals and principles to guide its BCMS implementation, operation, and improvement.

controls.control: Establish clear, measurable objectives that align with the organization's overall goals and risk appetite.
Create a set of principles that guide decision-making, resource allocation, and actions related to the BCMS.

controls.control_title: Document Strategic Objectives and Guiding Principles
controls.control: Formally document the strategic objectives and guiding principles for the BCMS and make them accessible to relevant stakeholders.

requirement_title: Competence and Communication in BCMS Operations
article_text: Clause 7 supports BCMS operations related to establishing competence and communication on a recurring/as-needed basis with interested parties, while documenting, controlling, maintaining and retaining required documented information.
requirement: Maintain competence and effective communication within the BCMS, as well as document, control, maintain, and retain necessary information
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that its personnel have the necessary skills to manage the BCMS effectively and communicate with relevant parties while maintaining proper documentation.

controls.control: Provide regular training programs to ensure all personnel are competent in their roles within the BCMS. Regularly assess and update competencies as necessary.
Define clear communication protocols for all personnel involved in the BCMS, ensuring effective and timely communication during incidents or routine operations.

Implement a system to manage all necessary documentation related to the BCMS, including policies, procedures, incident reports, and training records. Ensure proper version control and access restrictions.
Establish a process for reporting incidents within the BCMS and analyzing their root causes to improve future responses and prevent recurrences.
Develop a retention schedule outlining how long various types of information should be retained within the BCMS, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and minimizing storage costs.

article_text: Clause 9 summarizes the requirements necessary to measure business continuity performance, BCMS conformity with this document, and to conduct management review.
requirement: Measure business continuity performance, assess BCMS conformity, and conduct management reviews
requirement_description: The organization should monitor its business continuity performance, ensure adherence to the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) guidelines, and regularly review the system.

controls.control: Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of business continuity plans and regularly monitor and report on these metrics

article_text: Clause 10 identifies and acts on BCMS nonconformity and continual improvement through corrective action.

article_text: This document conforms to ISO’s requirements for management system standards.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Create a comprehensive business continuity plan that outlines procedures for maintaining critical operations during disruptions, and regularly review and update the plan.
Identify essential business functions and processes that must be maintained to meet the organization's objectives during a disruption.

controls.control_title: Establish Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO)
controls.control: Define the maximum acceptable downtime for critical systems and data, as well as the maximum tolerable data loss during a disruption.
Periodically assess the potential impact of various disruptions on the organization's operations, assets, and people to inform the development and maintenance of the business continuity plan.
Develop and document communication procedures for internal and external stakeholders during a disruption, including roles and responsibilities, contact information, and messaging protocols.

requirement: The terms and definitions given in ISO 22300 apply for the purposes of this document.
requirement_description: All terms used in the document should be understood according to their definitions provided in ISO 22300.

controls.control: Provide training to all relevant staff on the terms and definitions given in ISO 22300, ensuring a common understanding across the organization.
Establish a document management system that requires the use of ISO 22300 terms when creating or updating documents related to the project.

controls.control_title: Periodically Review and Update ISO 22300 Terms
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of the ISO 22300 terms and definitions, updating them as necessary to ensure they remain accurate and relevant.

requirement: The definition of 'activity' has been replaced and the example has been deleted.
requirement_description: The definition provided for 'activity' in ISO 22300:2018 has been updated.

controls.control: Create a clear, concise, and up-to-date definition of the term 'activity' in the organization's policies and procedures.
Modify system logic to reflect the updated definition of 'activity' in all relevant areas, ensuring consistent interpretation across the organization.
Review and update any documentation that references or is related to the term 'activity', such as data processing agreements, privacy policies, and standard operating procedures.

requirement: An audit is a systematic, independent and documented process for obtaining audit evidence and evaluating it objectively to determine the extent to which the audit criteria are fulfilled.
requirement_description: Audits should be conducted in a systematic manner, independently, and with proper documentation. The purpose of an audit is to evaluate whether the audit criteria have been met.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive audit plan outlining the objectives, scope, and methodology for each audit. The plan should be reviewed and updated regularly.
Ensure that the audit team is independent from the activities being audited to maintain objectivity and integrity of the audit process.
Maintain accurate, complete, and up-to-date records of all audit evidence obtained during the audit process. This includes documentation of findings, conclusions, and recommendations.
Evaluate the extent to which the audit criteria are fulfilled objectively, without bias or prejudice. This includes assessing compliance with laws, regulations, policies, and standards.

Effectively communicate the results of the audit to relevant stakeholders, including management, employees, and external parties. This includes providing clear explanations of findings, conclusions, and recommendations.

requirement: An audit can be an internal audit (first party), an external audit (second party or third party), and it can be a combined audit (combining two or more disciplines).
requirement_description: Audits can be conducted internally by the organization itself, externally by another party, or in combination with multiple disciplines.

controls.control: Create an internal audit committee to oversee and guide the audit process, ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations.
Clearly define the scope of audits (internal, external, combined) and their frequency to maintain a consistent audit schedule.
Keep accurate records of all audits conducted, including findings, recommendations, and actions taken. This will help in future audits and demonstrate compliance.
Assign a dedicated individual or team to coordinate the audit process, ensuring that all necessary preparations are made and that audits are conducted efficiently.
Establish procedures for following up on audit findings and recommendations, ensuring that corrective actions are taken in a timely manner.

requirement: An internal audit is conducted by the organization itself, or by an external party on its behalf.
requirement_description: The internal audit can be performed either by the organization or by an external entity acting on behalf of the organization.

controls.control: Establish a schedule for regular internal audits to ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and organizational policies.
Arrange for periodic audits by external parties to provide an independent assessment of the organization's compliance.

controls.control_title: Document Audit Findings and Actions Taken
controls.control: Maintain records of all audit findings, actions taken to address them, and their outcomes for future reference and continuous improvement.

requirement_title: Understanding of Audit Evidence and Audit Criteria
requirement: The terms 'audit evidence' and 'audit criteria' are defined in ISO 19011.
requirement_description: It is essential to understand the definitions of 'audit evidence' and 'audit criteria' as given in ISO 19011.

controls.control: Clearly define the criteria used to evaluate audit evidence, ensuring alignment with ISO 19011 standards.
Clearly define what constitutes as audit evidence and ensure all relevant data is collected, stored, and managed according to ISO 19011 standards.
Maintain accurate documentation of the defined audit criteria and evidence, including any updates or revisions.
Provide regular training to relevant personnel on the definition of audit criteria and evidence as per ISO 19011 standards.
Regularly review and update the defined audit criteria and evidence to ensure they remain relevant and effective in light of any changes within the organization or industry.

article_text: The fundamental elements of an audit include the determination of the conformity (3.7) of an object according to a procedure carried out by personnel not being responsible for the object audited.
requirement: Determine the conformity of an object according to a procedure carried out by personnel not responsible for the audited object
requirement_description: The audit process should be conducted by personnel who are independent from the object being audited.

controls.control: Form a committee of unbiased personnel to oversee the auditing process and ensure objectivity
Develop detailed procedures for the audit, outlining steps, responsibilities, and expected outcomes
Maintain records of all audits, including findings, recommendations, and actions taken to address them

requirement: Demonstrate independence by the freedom from responsibility for the activity being audited
requirement_description: The personnel conducting internal audits should be independent from the activities they are auditing.

controls.control: Ensure that no individual has the ability to perform all critical steps in a process, reducing the risk of fraud or error
Require more than one method of authentication for accessing sensitive systems and data
Periodically review user access rights to ensure that individuals only have the necessary permissions for their roles

requirement: An internal audit can be for management review and other internal purposes and can form the basis for an organization’s declaration of conformity.
requirement_description: Internal audits serve multiple purposes, including management reviews and providing a foundation for the organization's declaration of conformity.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive, scheduled, and documented internal audit plan that covers all relevant processes and systems.
Assign responsible individuals or teams to conduct internal audits, ensuring they have the necessary skills and training.
Create a system for documenting audit findings, including any non-conformities, recommendations, and management responses.
Establish procedures for addressing audit findings, prioritizing high-risk issues and ensuring timely resolution.
Store all internal audit records securely and make them available to relevant management for review, as well as for external audits or regulatory inquiries.

requirement: Second-party audits are conducted by parties having an interest in the organization, such as customers, or by other persons on their behalf.
requirement_description: Second-party audits are performed by interested parties like customers or their representatives.

controls.control: Develop a clear and comprehensive policy outlining the process, scope, frequency, and purpose of second-party audits.
Assign a dedicated individual or team to manage the coordination and execution of second-party audits.
Establish procedures for receiving, evaluating, and responding to audit requests from interested parties.
Keep records of all second-party audits, including reports, findings, and corrective actions taken.

requirement: Third-party audits are conducted by external, independent auditing organizations, such as those providing certification/registration of conformity or government agencies.
requirement_description: Third-party audits are performed by external and independent auditing organizations.

controls.control: Establish a process to engage external, independent auditing organizations for third-party audits. This could include certification/registration bodies or government agencies.
Ensure all relevant documentation, policies, and procedures are up-to-date and readily available for the auditing organization.
Implement any recommendations made by the auditing organization in a timely manner to maintain compliance.

article_text: business continuity capability of an organization (3.21) to continue the delivery of products and services (3.27) within acceptable time frames at predefined capacity during a disruption (3.10)
requirement: Maintain the ability to continue delivering products and services within acceptable timeframes during a disruption
requirement_description: The organization should be capable of continuing its operations, including product and service delivery, during a disruption.

controls.control: Develop, maintain, and test a comprehensive disaster recovery plan that outlines procedures for restoring critical systems and services in the event of a disruption.
Designate key personnel responsible for managing business continuity efforts, including incident response, communication, and recovery activities during a disruption.
Regularly backup critical data to an off-site location or cloud service to ensure accessibility in the event of a disruption at the primary site.

Periodically test and exercise the disaster recovery plan to identify any gaps, weaknesses, or areas for improvement in the organization's ability to continue delivering products and services during a disruption.
Implement redundant systems and services where possible to minimize the impact of a disruption on the organization's ability to deliver products and services.

article_text: documented information (3.11) that guides an organization (3.21) to respond to disruptions
requirement: Prepare a documented plan guiding the organization's response to disruptions
requirement_description: The organization should have a documented plan outlining its response to potential disruptions.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan (BCP)
controls.control: Create, implement, and maintain a comprehensive BCP that outlines the organization's response to various types of disruptions, including natural disasters, cyber-attacks, and operational failures.
Identify an off-site location to serve as a backup for critical operations in the event of a disruption at the primary site.
Assemble a cross-functional team responsible for managing and resolving incidents that may impact the organization's operations, security, or reputation.
Periodically test the BCP, DRS, and IRT to ensure their effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.

article_text: The definition has been replaced.
requirement: A documented information that guides an organization to respond to a disruption and resume, recover and restore the delivery of products and services consistent with its business continuity objectives.
requirement_description: Organizations must have a plan in place to respond to disruptions and ensure continuity of their operations.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive BCP that outlines the steps to be taken in response to a disruption, including recovery and resumption strategies.
Regularly backup critical data and store off-site to ensure quick restoration in case of a disruption.
Develop communication protocols for internal and external stakeholders during a disruption, including methods for updating the public.
Regularly conduct drills to test the effectiveness of the BCP and identify areas for improvement.

article_text: The outcome is a statement and justification of business continuity requirements.
requirement: A process of analysing the impact over time of a disruption on the organization.
requirement_description: Organizations must assess the potential impact of disruptions on their operations.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Impact Analysis (BIA)
controls.control: Create, maintain, and regularly update a comprehensive BIA to identify critical business functions, processes, systems, and data that are essential for the organization's operations. This analysis should also include potential threats, vulnerabilities, and recovery time objectives.

Develop, test, and maintain a DRP that outlines the steps to be taken in the event of a disruption. The plan should include procedures for data backup, system recovery, communication with stakeholders, and resumption of business operations.

Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential threats, vulnerabilities, and risks to the organization's operations. These assessments should consider both internal and external factors and provide recommendations for mitigation.
Establish KPIs to measure the organization's performance and resilience. These KPIs should be regularly monitored and analyzed to identify trends, potential issues, and areas for improvement.

article_text: This constitutes one of the common terms and core definitions of the high level structure for ISO management system standards.
requirement: The ability to apply knowledge and skills to achieve intended results.
requirement_description: Organizations must ensure that individuals have the necessary competence to perform their roles effectively.

controls.control: Develop and implement a continuous learning program that encourages employees to acquire new skills, knowledge, and competencies relevant to their roles.
Regularly assess the skills of employees to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement, and provide appropriate training or development programs.
Establish a knowledge management system that allows employees to easily access, share, and collaborate on information, best practices, and lessons learned.

article_text: This constitutes one of the common terms and core definitions of the high level structure for ISO management system standards.
requirement: Fulfilment of a requirement.
requirement_description: Organizations must comply with all applicable requirements.

controls.control: Create and maintain a comprehensive document outlining all system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and compliance requirements.
Develop and enforce change management processes to ensure that any changes made to the system are properly documented, tested, and approved before implementation.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update System Requirements
controls.control: Establish a schedule for reviewing and updating system requirements to ensure they remain current and relevant.

article_text: This constitutes one of the common terms and core definitions of the high level structure for ISO management system standards.
requirement: A recurring activity to enhance performance.
requirement_description: Organizations must continuously improve their performance.

controls.control: Schedule regular system maintenance to ensure optimal performance, including updating software, clearing temporary files, and defragmenting databases.
Implement a monitoring system to track system performance metrics such as CPU usage, memory consumption, and disk space. Use this data to identify bottlenecks and optimize resources.
Ensure all software is regularly updated to the latest versions, as updates often include performance enhancements.

requirement: Take action to eliminate the cause(s) of a nonconformity and prevent recurrence
requirement_description: Upon identifying a nonconformity, actions must be taken to address its root cause and prevent it from happening again

controls.control: Conduct a thorough investigation to identify the root cause(s) of the nonconformity, document findings, and implement corrective actions.
Develop and implement a corrective action plan to address the root cause(s) of the nonconformity, including timelines for completion.
Create a preventive action plan to ensure that the nonconformity does not recur, addressing any systemic issues or weaknesses uncovered during the investigation.
Update documentation and provide training to relevant personnel on the corrective and preventive actions taken, as well as any changes in policies or procedures.

requirement: Understand and manage disruptions
requirement_description: The organization should be aware of and handle any potential or ongoing disruptions to maintain smooth operations

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Create, test, and maintain a comprehensive business continuity plan that outlines procedures for responding to disruptions, including recovery strategies and key personnel roles.
Set up an off-site disaster recovery location with backup systems, data, and applications to minimize downtime in the event of a major disruption.

controls.control_title: Implement Regular Backup and Data Recovery Procedures
controls.control: Schedule regular backups of critical data and systems, test recovery procedures, and maintain off-site copies to ensure quick restoration in case of data loss.
Perform periodic disaster recovery drills to test the effectiveness of the business continuity plan and identify areas for improvement.

article_text: incident (3.14), whether anticipated or unanticipated, that causes an unplanned, negative deviation from the expected delivery of products and services according to an organization’s objectives
requirement: An incident is an event that can cause a disruption, loss, emergency or crisis
requirement_description: Incidents are events that may lead to unexpected deviations in the delivery of products and services as per an organization's objectives

controls.control: Develop and maintain a comprehensive incident response plan outlining roles, responsibilities, communication protocols, and escalation procedures.
Establish logging and monitoring mechanisms to detect potential incidents early and respond promptly.
Provide regular security awareness training to employees to ensure they are aware of the signs of an incident and know how to report them.
Regularly backup critical data to minimize potential loss in case of an incident.

article_text: documented information required to be controlled and maintained by an organization and the medium on which it is contained
requirement: An organization must manage documented information
requirement_description: Documented information refers to management system-related processes, operational documentation, and records. It should be controlled and maintained.

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a comprehensive policy that outlines how to create, manage, store, and dispose of all organizational documents.
Develop detailed procedures for document control, including versioning, access, and approval processes.
Establish a retention schedule that outlines how long documents should be kept before they are disposed of or archived.
Implement appropriate security measures to protect documents from unauthorized access, modification, and destruction.
Restrict document access to authorized personnel only, using role-based access controls or similar mechanisms.

article_text: extent to which planned activities are realized and planned results achieved
requirement: An organization must evaluate the effectiveness of its planned activities and results
requirement_description: The organization should assess if its planned activities have been successfully carried out and desired outcomes have been achieved.

controls.control: Define measurable objectives for each activity, track progress, and evaluate the impact of activities on organizational goals
Schedule periodic reviews to assess the effectiveness of planned activities and make necessary adjustments
Create channels for stakeholders to provide feedback on the results of planned activities, and use this feedback to improve future planning

article_text: outcome of a disruption affecting objectives
requirement: An organization must assess the impact of any disruption on its objectives
requirement_description: The organization should evaluate the consequences of any disruptions on its objectives.

controls.control: Regularly conduct a Business Impact Analysis to identify critical business processes, systems, and data that are essential for the organization's objectives. This analysis helps in understanding the potential impact of any disruption.
Perform a risk assessment to identify, evaluate, and prioritize risks that could disrupt the organization's objectives. This helps in focusing resources on addressing the most significant risks.
Regularly test and update the Disaster Recovery Plan to ensure it is effective in minimizing the impact of any disruption. This helps in maintaining business continuity.

article_text: 3.14 incident event that can be, or could lead to, a disruption (3.10), loss, emergency or crisis
requirement: An incident is an event that can cause disruptions, losses, emergencies, or crises.
requirement_description: This requirement defines what constitutes an incident in the context of the management system.

controls.control: Designate key personnel responsible for managing incidents, including a team leader, communication liaison, and technical experts.
Create a comprehensive plan outlining the steps to be taken during an incident, including roles, responsibilities, communication protocols, and escalation procedures.
Establish clear channels for reporting incidents, ensuring that all employees know how to report an incident and understand the importance of doing so promptly.
Provide regular training and exercises for the incident response team to ensure they are familiar with the incident response plan and can effectively respond to incidents.
Keep a record of all incidents, including their causes, resolutions, and any lessons learned for future reference and continuous improvement.

article_text: 3.15 interested party (preferred term) stakeholder (admitted term) person or organization (3.21) that can affect, be affected by, or perceive itself to be affected by a decision or activity (3.1)
requirement: An interested party is a person or organization that can influence or be influenced by decisions or activities.
requirement_description: This requirement defines the term 'interested party', which includes various stakeholders such as customers, owners, personnel, providers, bankers, regulators, unions, partners, society, competitors, and opposing pressure groups.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive list of all individuals or organizations that can influence or be influenced by decisions or activities, and ensure this list is regularly updated.
Set up clear communication channels with interested parties to facilitate information exchange and maintain transparency in decision-making processes.
Maintain records of interactions with interested parties, including meetings, phone calls, emails, and any other forms of communication, for future reference and compliance purposes.

article_text: 3.16 management system set of interrelated or interacting elements of an organization (3.21) to establish policies (3.24) and objectives (3.20) and processes (3.26) to achieve those objectives Note 1 to entry: A management system can address a single discipline or several disciplines. Note 2 to entry: The system elements include the organization’s structure, roles and responsibilities, planning and operation.
requirement: A management system is a set of interrelated elements that establish policies, objectives, and processes to achieve those objectives.
requirement_description: This requirement defines the term 'management system', which encompasses an organization's structure, roles, responsibilities, planning, operation, and more.

controls.control: Develop and document comprehensive policies that outline the objectives, roles, responsibilities, and procedures for the management system.
Set specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) objectives that align with the overall goals of the organization.
Develop, document, implement, and maintain processes to achieve the defined objectives. These processes should be efficient, effective, and consistent.
Clearly define roles and responsibilities within the management system, ensuring that all individuals understand their duties and obligations.
Regularly review and update the management system to ensure its continued relevance, effectiveness, and efficiency. This includes conducting internal audits and management reviews.

requirement: The system elements include the organization’s structure
requirement_description: The organization must define and maintain its structure as part of its management system

controls.control: Create and maintain an accurate organizational chart to clearly define roles, responsibilities, and reporting lines within the organization
Develop and regularly update a comprehensive document outlining the organizational structure, including departmental hierarchies, job titles, and roles
Ensure that all employees have access to the organizational structure documentation and understand their role within it

requirement: The system elements include roles and responsibilities
requirement_description: The organization must clearly define roles and responsibilities within its management system

controls.control: Clearly define and document all roles within the system, including their associated responsibilities and permissions.
Designate a specific individual to be responsible for each role in the system, ensuring accountability and oversight.
Maintain a record of any changes made to roles and responsibilities within the system, including the date, reason for change, and individual responsible.

requirement: The system elements include planning
requirement_description: The organization must have a planning process in place as part of its management system

controls.control: Develop a detailed plan outlining the system's objectives, functions, and processes to ensure effective and efficient operation.
Create written procedures for planning activities, including decision-making, resource allocation, and risk management.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update the System Plan
controls.control: Establish a schedule for reviewing and updating the system plan to ensure it remains relevant and effective in achieving its objectives.

requirement: The system elements include operation
requirement_description: The organization must have operational processes in place as part of its management system

controls.control: Regularly assess operational risks associated with system elements to ensure their effectiveness and efficiency.
Develop, document, and maintain standard operating procedures for all system operations.
Regularly monitor system operations to ensure they are being performed according to established procedures.

requirement: The scope of a management system can include...
requirement_description: The organization must define the extent and boundaries of its management system

controls.control: Clearly define the boundaries of the management system, including its functions, processes, and activities.
Identify all interfaces between the management system and other systems or departments to ensure proper coordination and information flow.
Document any external influences, such as laws, regulations, or industry standards, that may impact the management system's scope.

requirement: ...the whole of the organization, specific and identified functions of the organization, specific and identified sections of the organization, or one or more functions across a group of organizations.
requirement_description: The organization has flexibility in defining the scope of its management system

controls.control_title: Define and Document Organizational Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Clearly define and document roles, responsibilities, and reporting lines for all functions, sections, or groups within the organization to ensure accountability and compliance.
Develop, implement, maintain, and continually improve a compliance management system that addresses all applicable laws, regulations, and standards.
Regularly assess the organization's risk profile to identify potential compliance issues and implement appropriate controls to mitigate those risks.

requirement_title: Adherence to ISO Management System Standards
requirement: This constitutes one of the common terms and core definitions of the high level structure for ISO management system standards.
requirement_description: The organization must adhere to the common terms and core definitions of the high level structure for ISO management system standards

controls.control: Clearly define the boundaries and extent of the management system, including products, services, and processes
Identify and consider all internal and external issues that can affect the organization's ability to achieve its objectives
Create, maintain, and protect documented information required by the management system
